alert.note: Alert for Cullman (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 4:47PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Cullman County through 530 PM CDT... At 447 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Dodge City, or 11 miles southwest of Cullman, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cullman, Hanceville, Good Hope, Dodge City, Baldwin, Vinemont, West Point, Eva, Colony and Phelan. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
